intro: Gymnosphaera phlebodes, commonly known as the red sandwort, is a perennial flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native habitat and is of interest to botanists studying xerophytic adaptations.
